hero.subtitle: Most habit apps fail because they skip the foundation: understanding who you already are. Votive guides you through AI-powered self-discovery before goal-setting.

philosophy.label: The Problem
philosophy.title: Goals fail when they skip the self
philosophy.p1: You've tried habit trackers. Morning routines. 21-day challenges. They work for a while, then dissolve. Not because you lack discipline, but because you started in the wrong place.
philosophy.p2: Real change doesn't begin with goals. It begins with understanding who you already are: your energy patterns, your hidden motivations, the unconscious behaviors that shape your days.
philosophy.quote: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.

journey.label: The Journey
journey.title: Five phases of transformation
journey.subtitle: Votive guides you through a deliberate progression: from understanding who you are to becoming who you aspire to be.

1.name: State Awareness
1.title: Know your rhythms
1.description: Map your energy cycles, mood triggers, and willpower patterns. Discover what drains you and what restores you.

2.name: Identity Mapping
2.title: See yourself clearly
2.description: Examine your current identity, automatic behaviors, and keystone habits. Surface your core values and natural strengths.

3.name: Identity Design
3.title: Envision your future self
3.description: Define your aspirational identity and create believable stepping-stones to bridge the gap.

4.name: System Design
4.title: Build your architecture
4.description: Design habit loops, optimize your environment, and create accountability structures.

5.name: Integration
5.title: Embody the change
5.description: Track progress, collect behavioral evidence, and reinforce your evolving identity.

insights.label: AI Insights
insights.title: Intelligence that understands you
insights.subtitle: Claude analyzes your responses to find patterns, contradictions, and leverage points that rule-based systems would miss.

sampleCard.label: Sample Analysis
sampleCard.quote: "You describe yourself as <highlight>disciplined</highlight>, yet your energy crashes and mood triggers suggest you're running on <highlight>willpower alone</highlight>, a finite resource. Your keystone behavior of morning exercise could be the anchor that replenishes rather than depletes, if you shift from forcing performance to honoring rhythm."
sampleCard.analysis: This isn't hypocrisy, it's a gap between your aspirational and actual identity. Understanding this tension is the first step to bridging it.

cta.title: Ready to understand yourself?
cta.subtitle: The assessment takes about 15 minutes. No accounts, no tracking, just honest reflection.
